result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Adjoining States. Signed by RMW on 08/17/22. arc   c: SCSO with Complaint. e: DA

1:30 pm CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joseph Macon Jr. not in court. Attorney status hearing. JSC representative in court. JSC states JSC has had contact with def as recently as Monday, August 15th. Def has called in today at JSC. Court issues WARRANT - adjoining states. Court will hear case to quash warrant if he appears for testing tomorrow, August 18, 2022. After testing he should report immediately to Branch 4. JSC may bring def to courtroom #4 after testing.
Pretrial Bond Report, filed by JSC. bph   To RMW for review
22SW259 executed on 8/3/2022. Search Warrant, Application and Affidavit signed by RMW on 8/3/2022. Filed in 22CF531. olg
Pretrial Assessment Report. SEALED w/ access to parties.  gll

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and random ETG testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

1:12 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, Attorney Michael Joseph Becker and Intern Connor Smith in court for State of Wisconsin.Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Joseph Macon Jr. Defendant Joseph Macon Jr. appeared by video, in custody. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands. Waives reading. DE updates address. State requests bond. Atty. Harrelson makes argument. DE does not qualify for public defender, PFAC provided. Court sets bond. Court sets PTC for attorney status. Adjourned: 1:17 PM. kma
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
